required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dasatinib Added to Gemcitabine for Subjects With Locally-advanced Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Placebo-controlled Double-blind Trial of Dasatinib Added to Gemcitabine for Subjects With Locally-advanced Pancreatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether patients with locally advanced pancreatic cancer who receive dasatinib added to standard of care (gemcitabine) live longer, compared to patients who receive standard of care (gemcitabine) plus placebo; i.e. gemcitabine alone.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until date of death from any cause by 02 December 2013
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival (OS) is the time from randomization until time of death from any cause by 02 December 2013.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization to earliest PFS event by 02 December 2013
secondary_outcome.description: PFS - time from randomization to unequivocal local or distant disease progression, death or discontinuation from trial for any reason by 02 December 2013. Progression events were determined according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor (RECIST) 1.1 every 8 weeks.

arm_group.description: One arm will receive standard of care treatment (ie, GEM 1000 mg/m2 by intravenous [IV] infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle) plus dasatinib 100 mg by mouth once daily (QD).
The other arm will receive standard of care treatment (ie, GEM 1000 mg/m2 by intravenous [IV] infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle) plus matched placebo by mouth once daily (QD).

intervention.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by intravenous [IV] infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus dasatinib 100 mg (or matched placebo) by mouth once daily (QD). Subjects will continue to receive study treatment until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, withdrawal of consent, or study termination.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologic or cytologic documentation of unresectable adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.
- Recovery from toxicity of previous procedures to establish the diagnosis. ECOG PS 0 or 1.
- Adequate organ function.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of metastatic disease.
- Previous radiotherapy or chemoradiotherapy.
- History of or current pleural effusion.
- History of significant cardiovascular disease.
- Clinically significant bleeding disorder or coagulopathy.
- Concomitant medication with strong CYP 3A4 inhibitor.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 202 participants were enrolled at 79 study sites in 15 countries.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to receive dasatinib + gemcitabine (GEM) or placebo + GEM. Participants were stratified at the time of randomization by baseline Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status (ECOG PS) (0 versus 1) and intent to receive radiotherapy (RT) (yes or no).

group.title: Dasatinib + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by intravenous (IV) infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus dasatinib 100 mg by mouth once daily (QD).

group.title: Placebo + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by IV infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus matched placebo by mouth QD.

group.title: Dasatinib + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by IV infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus dasatinib 100 mg by mouth QD.

group.title: Placebo + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by IV infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus matched placebo by mouth QD.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival (OS) is the time from randomization until time of death from any cause by 02 December 2013.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization until date of death from any cause by 02 December 2013
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) data which was composed of all randomized participants.

group.title: Dasatinib + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by IV infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus dasatinib 100 mg by mouth QD

group.title: Placebo + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by IV infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus matched placebo by mouth QD.

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival (OS) is the time from randomization until time of death from any cause by 02 December 2013.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) data which was composed of all randomized participants.

analysis.groups_desc: Using a 1-sided alpha=0.2, a population of 200 participants (100 GEM plus dasatinib and 100 GEM plus placebo) has 79% power to show an increase in median OS from 10 to 13.3 months (hazard ratio [HR] =0.75, assuming analysis of 135 deaths).
analysis.p_value_desc: The log-rank test was used to test OS. As a sensitivity analysis, HR and its confidence interval was also provided for OS using the Cox proportional hazard model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for baseline factors - treatment, ECOG PS, region, CA19-9 level (< 1000 IU/mL or >/=1000 IU/mL), and RT during trial (yes or no).

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS - time from randomization to unequivocal local or distant disease progression, death or discontinuation from trial for any reason by 02 December 2013. Progression events were determined according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor (RECIST) 1.1 every 8 weeks.
outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization to earliest PFS event by 02 December 2013
outcome.population: The ITT data which was composed of all randomized participants.

group.title: Dasatinib + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by IV infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus dasatinib 100 mg by mouth QD.

group.title: Placebo + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by IV infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus matched placebo by mouth QD.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS - time from randomization to unequivocal local or distant disease progression, death or discontinuation from trial for any reason by 02 December 2013. Progression events were determined according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor (RECIST) 1.1 every 8 weeks.
measure.population: The ITT data which was composed of all randomized participants.

analysis.groups_desc: Trial has 88% power to show a median PFS increase from 5 to 7 months (with 1-sided alpha=0.15, total 176 events, HR=0.714).
analysis.p_value_desc: The log-rank test was used to test PFS. As a sensitivity analysis, HR and its confidence interval was also provided for PFS using the Cox proportional hazard model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for baseline factors: treatment, ECOG PS, region, CA19-9 level (< 1000 IU/mL or >/=1000 IU/mL), and RT during trial (yes or no).

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected from randomization, throughout each treatment cycle to final study visit. Follow-up visits conducted until all ongoing AEs resolved or clinically stable.
reported_events.desc: The safety data set (participants who received at least one dose of study treatment) included 98 participants in the Dasatinib + GEM group and 101 participants in the placebo + GEM group.

group.title: Dasatinib + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by IV infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus dasatinib 100 mg by mouth QD

group.title: Placebo + GEM
group.description: GEM 1000 mg/m2 by IV infusion weekly for 3 weeks of a 4-week cycle plus matched placebo by mouth QD.

event.sub_title: Infective exacerbation of chronic obstructive airways disease

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: 5 participants (who had not experienced disease progression at the time of event-driven data cut-off) were told the study results and were instructed to indicate “sponsor discontinued study” if they did not want to continue in the study.

point_of_contact.organization: Otsuka Pharmaceutical Development and Commercialization, Inc.
